column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2018
column14: I will never go camping without having a fresh pack of these in my bag.

column6: Women and backcountry campers, take note
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
column14: My husband and I used these wipes on a 10-day backcountry sea kayaking trip. It didn't really matter that they were biodegradable because we have to pack everything out anyway; they're also faintly fragrant, so we kept them in a bear can the whole time. But they were wonderful for cleaning our faces, underarms, etc. I unfortunately had to deal with breakthrough bleeding for most of the trip, and I used these wipes regularly to clean up--and I never experienced any kind of irritation or problem! I'm normally a little sensitive to irritants. What a relief.

column6: if you don't mind the scent these are a great size for traveling/camping and did work well
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
column14: While this product says it is unscented, I noticed a rather strong kind of floral scent. It did not irritate my skin (which is very sensitive), but I didn't care for the smell and probably wouldn't purchase it again.

column6: Over a year old in the package and still doing their thing
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2019
column14: I purchased a pack of these last summer when I section-hiked the Appalachian Trail.  This year, I purchased a new pack thinking that the old one would be dried out.  It wasn't, so I brought it along this year with my new pack.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2018

column6: A great product. Only problem is that wipes come in ...
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2018
column14: Used on three day mountain bike trip in Canyon Lands National Park. Worked very well, thick and soft. A great product. Only problem is that wipes come in non resealable pack. Only used a couple, unfortunately I did not have a zip lock bag to to put rest of wipes in. The rest dried out by the third day and were wasted. This flaw needs to be fixed. Take a zip lock bag if you do not plan on using all of them at once.

column6: They kept me clean trekking to the Everest Base Camp
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2018
column14: What do you do when there is no heat in the place where you are staying and the temperature is low.  I guess if you are tough you take a shower or jump in a pond.  Me, I'm not tough - so I settled for body wipes.  Admittedly cold when they come out of the package, but quick to warm up.  The Combat wipes came out of the package easily and maintained their moisture content once the package was open for about 16 days at which time the package was fully consumed.  They did a fine job of removing sweat and grime, and no one complained about being in my vicinity - at least they were too polite to say anything.  The wipes were a great alternative to showering where there was no guarantee of warm or hot water and no place to dry office without freezing.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
column14: The notion that there can be anything 'combat' about wet wipes is incredibly ridiculous, of course. I put them in my strategic backpack with my tactical sleeping bag. The marketing people are out of control.
